column1: For at least 7-8 days dry cough, progressive dyspnea fever. Deny contact with COVID19 positive subjects, deny travel abroad or in the red areas. He lives with his wife who has had cough and fever but is currently asymptomatic. It was evaluated by the continuity care doctor who would have prescribed antibiotic therapy with Augmentin, antipyretic (paracetamol) and anti-inflammatory (ketoprofen), without benefit. Previous colon noeplasia. Positive pharyngeal swab on 3/3/20.
